intro: Meum athamanticum subsp. nevadense, commonly known as the Nevada thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish to white flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. The subspecies is distinguished by its smaller size and specific geographic distribution compared to other subspecies of Meum athamanticum.
